page.title: 15CHANGES IN GILMORTON
page.content: The children interviewed a lady who has lived in Gilmorton for 50 years.She told them that there used to be 500 people living in the village,about 200 fewer than now.There used to be many more shops than there are now including 2 butchers,one of which was thatched,sweet shops including one made of mud,a post office and a bake-house.There was also a stocking factory which sent its goods by horse and cart to Leicester.Many of the houses were mud and thatched.The school was where the present Crown Inn is.There were two classrooms and two teachers,with the headmistress living behind the school.A bell,which is still hung,called the children to school.The present school was a big,dark house.Most of the villagers were farmers or shop-owners.
